metadata.dc:author: Tramoyeres Galvañ, Alfredo
Zaragozá Orts, Julio
Sánchez Ballester, Francisco
de la Torre Abril, Luis
López Alcina, Emilio
Cánovas Ivorra, José Antonio
Ramada Benlloch, Francisco
Navalón Verdejo, Pedro
metadata.dc:description: OBJECTIVES We report one case of seminal vesicle cyst with ectopic drainage of the left ureter. We performed a bibliographic review of this pathology. METHODS 23-year-old patient who presented several episodes of acute epididymitis. Complementary study showed a retroprostatic cystic structure on transrectal ultrasound. Surgical treatment with resection of the cystic structure was proposed. RESULTS The clinical picture which caused the process was solved and the patient keeps his fertility. CONCLUSIONS This is a rather infrequent pathology that urologists should know. We bring up the need of performing complementary studies in pathologies that in spite of seeming banal do not progress satisfactorily.
metadata.dc:title: Quiste de vesícula seminal. A propósito de un caso y revisión de la literatura.
[Seminal vesicle cyst. Report of one case and bibliography review].
